title: The Three-Way Communication Model
content: Three-way communication ensures message receipt and understanding: sender transmits, receiver repeats back, sender confirms or corrects. This closed loop catches errors before they cause problems. It takes seconds longer but prevents minutes or hours of error correction.

mcq.question: You instruct a technician to set pressure to 250 PSI. They respond 'Setting pressure to 250.' What's missing?

options.B: Your confirmation that their readback was correct

mcq.explanation: Three-way communication requires sender confirmation. Without it, you don't know if they heard correctly. The third step closes the loop: 'Correct, 250 PSI.'

openQuestions: In what situations do you skip the third confirmation step?
What errors has three-way communication caught in your experience?
